item.title: 特朗普获胜迫使华尔街一度声势浩大的一角重整旗鼓
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫，迫使华尔街一个术语较多的角落重新思考其谈话要点。【原文：Donald Trump’s return to the White House is forcing one of Wall Street’s more jargon-filled corners to rethink its talking points.】

item.title: 阿尔及利亚罕见首次公开募股后，2025 年至少还将有三家公司上市
item.description: 阿尔及利亚今年 3 月进行了八年来的首次公开募股，预计 2025 年至少还将有三次公开募股，因为该国希望发展规模小、流动性差的证券交易所，并实现经济多样化。【原文：Algeria, which in March saw its first public initial offering in eight years, expects at least three others in 2025 as it looks to grow its small and illiquid stock exchange and diversify the economy.】

item.title: 美国机构对阿达尼斯里兰卡项目进行尽职调查
item.description: 一家同意向斯里兰卡阿达尼集团支持的港口开发项目贷款 5 亿多美元的美国机构表示，在该企业集团的亿万富翁创始人和其他高管被指控行贿之后，该机构仍在对该项目进行尽职调查。【原文：A US agency that agreed to lend more than $500 million to an Adani Group-backed port development in Sri Lanka said it’s still conducting due diligence on the project, following bribery allegations against the conglomerate’s billionaire founder and other top executives.】

item.title: 苹果在电视领域的下一步应该是流媒体手柄而非全套设备
item.description: 苹果不需要自己的电视机。但它应该生产一种低成本的电视流媒体棒，将其内容、应用程序和智能家居功能带给更多家庭。还有Siri 将在现代人工智能时代改头换面；亚马逊击败苹果，推出新款智能家居显示器；Oura 和 Dexcom 合作，力图将血糖跟踪技术推向主流。【原文：Apple doesn’t need its own TV set. But it should make a low-cost TV streaming stick to bring its content, apps and smart home features to more households. Also: Siri will be revamped for the modern AI era; Amazon beats Apple to new smart home displays; and Oura and Dexcom team up in a bid to make glucose tracking mainstream.】

item.title: 新兴市场应对 "特朗普经济学"，垃圾债券面临风险
item.description: 如果唐纳德-特朗普说到做到，新兴市场的垃圾债券反弹有可能只是过去四年债务危机和未来四年新一轮困境之间的一个插曲。【原文：The junk-bond rally in emerging markets risks being just an interlude between the debt crisis of the past four years and a new bout of distress in the next four, if Donald Trump does what he says he will.】

item.title: 伊朗计划本周与欧洲国家举行核会谈
item.description: 据共同社周日援引未透露身份的伊朗外交消息人士的话报道，伊朗计划本周与英国、法国和德国就其核计划举行会谈。【原文：Iran plans to hold talks about its nuclear program with the UK, France and Germany this week, Kyodo reported on Sunday, citing Iranian diplomatic sources who weren’t identified.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利与美国同行一道将中东总部设在利雅得
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）获得监管部门批准，将其中东总部设在沙特阿拉伯，与花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Morgan Stanley got regulatory approval to locate its Middle East headquarters in Saudi Arabia, joining Wall Street rivals including Citigroup Inc. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc. in expanding their presence in the kingdom.】

item.title: 预计感恩节一周全美将有冬季风暴
item.description: 美联社）— 美国各地的预报员发出警告说，新一轮的冬季天气可能会使感恩节假期前的旅行变得更加复杂，而加利福尼亚州和华盛顿州仍在继续从风暴破坏和停电中恢复。【原文：WINDSOR, Calif. (AP) — Forecasters through the U.S. issued warnings that another round of winter weather could complicate travel leading up to the Thanksgiving holiday, while California and Washington state continue to recover from storm damage and power outages.】

item.title: 国内电力需求下降，埃及重新审视液化天然气进口需求
item.description: 在国内电力需求下降和缩减开支的背景下，埃及最近转移了一批液化天然气货物，正在重新审视其能源进口需求。【原文：Egypt, which recently diverted a number of incoming liquefied natural gas shipments, is reviewing its energy import needs amid a fall in domestic power demand and a drive to trim spending.】

item.title: 中国将打击基于算法的不公平互联网行为
item.description: 中国网络空间管理局周日发表声明称，中国政府已启动专项计划，打击互联网上各种不正当、不合规的行为，以维护网民和企业的利益。【原文：The Chinese government has started a special program to crack down various unfair and non-compliant practices on the internet to safeguard the interests of netizens and companies, according to a statement from the Cyberspace Administration of China on Sunday.】

item.title: 伊朗为特朗普重启经济制裁做好准备
item.description: 2017 年唐纳德-特朗普刚刚入主白宫时，赛勒斯-拉扎吉（Cyrus Razzaghi）正在经营一家伊朗商业咨询公司，为美国、日本和欧洲公司提供建议，帮助他们如何在一个摆脱多年经济孤立的市场中抓住机遇。【原文：When Donald Trump first entered the White House in 2017, Cyrus Razzaghi was running an Iranian business consultancy, advising US, Japanese and European companies about how to grab opportunities in a market emerging from years of economic isolation.】

item.title: 官员警告：英国基金在国内投资不足可能面临税收打击
item.description: 英国商业银行（British Business Bank）负责人警告说，随着政府推行一项重要的增长举措，英国可能会收回资产管理公司未能在国内进行足够投资的养老金税收减免。【原文：The UK could claw back pension tax breaks from asset managers that fail to invest enough domestically, the head of the British Business Bank said in a warning about the stakes for the industry as the government pursues a key growth initiative.】

item.title: 卢特尼克的 Cantor 正在与 Tether 就价值 20 亿美元的比特币借贷项目进行谈判
item.description: 霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）正着手加强与数字资产业务领域最重要、最具争议性的公司之一的合作：Tether 控股有限公司【原文：Howard Lutnick is moving to strengthen his alliance with one of the most important and controversial names in the digital-asset business: Tether Holdings Ltd.】

item.title: 警方称因诈骗被通缉的泰国医疗大亨逃往中国
item.description: 泰国医院大亨文-瓦纳信（Boon Vanasin）以虚假医疗项目骗取了约 75 亿泰铢（约合 2.17 亿美元）的投资，现已逃往中国，警方已对其发出逮捕令。【原文：Thai hospital tycoon Boon Vanasin, who lured some 7.5 billion baht ($217 million) of investments in fake medical projects, has fled to China, prompting the police to issue a warrant for his arrest.】

item.title: 阿达尼被美国证交会传唤解释贿赂案中的立场
item.description: 据印度报业托拉斯（Press Trust of India）报道，印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）和他的侄子萨加尔-阿达尼（Sagar Adani）被美国证券交易委员会传唤，就有关他们为赢得太阳能发电合同行贿超过 2.5 亿美元的指控做出解释。【原文：Indian billionaire Gautam Adani and his nephew, Sagar Adani, were summoned by the US Securities and Exchange Commission to explain allegations that they paid more than $250 million in bribes to win solar-power contracts, Press Trust of India reported.】

item.title: 阿达尼行贿案将如何考验美国法律的长臂
item.description: 美国检察官在争取监禁亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）的过程中面临着巨大的法律和外交障碍，因为他涉嫌帮助策划向印度官员行贿超过 2.5 亿美元，并欺诈美国投资者。【原文：US prosecutors face steep legal and diplomatic hurdles in their bid to imprison billionaire Gautam Adani for allegedly helping plot bribes of more than $250 million to officials in India and defraud US investors.】

item.title: 澳大利亚政府撤销关于社交媒体错误信息的法案
item.description: 由于未能获得足够的跨党派支持，澳大利亚政府将不会继续立法强制社交媒体网站打击其平台上的不实信息。【原文：The Australian government won’t proceed with legislation that would have forced social media sites to crack down on misinformation on their platforms after failing to win enough cross-party support.】

item.title: Man Group、Abrdn 指望中国刺激政策重振牛市
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的回归给中国 10 万亿美元的股市蒙上了一层阴影，但对一些基金经理来说，狂欢尚未结束。【原文：Donald Trump’s return has cast a pall over China’s $10 trillion stock market, but for some money managers, the party isn’t yet over.】

item.title: 斯塔默称 "激增的福利法案 "正在 "玷污我们的社会
item.description: 基尔-斯塔默爵士（Sir Keir Starmer）承诺进行全面改革，以打击他所描述的 "使我们的社会蒙羞的巨额福利账单"。【原文：Sir Keir Starmer has promised sweeping changes to crack down on what he described as the "bulging benefits bill blighting our society".】

item.title: 顽固的美国通胀将强化美联储的 "减速 "政策
item.description: 下周的美国通胀数据将显示出顽固的物价压力，这将强化美联储对未来降息的谨慎态度。【原文：US inflation figures in the coming week that are seen showing stubborn price pressures will reinforce the Federal Reserve’s cautionary posture toward future interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 信贷炙手可热，交易员开始做空
item.description: 由于全球经济依然强劲，资产经理们有钱可花，却很少有新的交易可买，这就把信贷息差推高到接近历史高位。对一些人来说，这是一个信号，表明是时候购买下行保护了。【原文：Asset managers with money to spend and few new deals to buy have pushed credit spreads to near all-time tights as the global economy remains strong. That’s a signal for some that it’s time to buy downside protection.】

item.title: 印度太阳能机构证实阿达尼起诉书中的关键细节
item.description: 印度负责拍卖阿达尼绿色能源有限公司（Adani Green Energy Ltd.）起诉案核心太阳能项目的机构证实，在最初的中标者拒绝开发这些项目后，该机构将 2.3 千兆瓦的发电量分配给了这家企业集团。【原文：The Indian agency in charge of auctioning a solar project at the center of Adani Green Energy Ltd.’s indictment confirmed it allotted 2.3 gigawatts capacity to the conglomerate, after the original winner refused to develop them.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦称欧洲央行可独立于美联储行动降低利率
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，无论美联储发生什么变化，欧洲中央银行的政策都将随之发展。【原文：European Central Bank policy will develop regardless of what happens at the Federal Reserve, according to Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.】

item.title: 谈判代表称，主要国家就大纲达成一致，COP29 协议指日可待
item.description: COP29 似乎将达成最后的协议，因为谈判代表们同意了一项关于资金的协议的大纲，将在阿塞拜疆举行的气候谈判从破裂的边缘拉了回来。【原文：COP29 appeared set for a last ditch deal as negotiators agreed the broad outline of a deal on finance, pulling the climate talks in Azerbaijan back from the brink of breaking down.】

item.title: 特朗普选择斯科特-贝森特为财政部长，是对华尔街的顺从
item.description:
最终，这场充满戏剧性的搜索以一位对冲基金高管为起点— ，他花了数月时间有条不紊地为提名打下基础。【原文：

In the end, the drama-filled search landed where it started — with a hedge fund executive who’d spent months methodically laying the groundwork for a nomination.

】

item.title: 对于押注股市反弹的华尔街专业人士来说，历史毫无用处
item.description: 在总统大选之后，股市通常会出现反弹，投资者在押注股市反弹方面面临挑战：由于 S&P 500 指数有望创下有史以来最好的一年开局之一，这次历史无法成为指南。【原文：Investors have a challenge in betting on the usual stock market rally that tends to arrive after a presidential election: With the S&P 500 Index on track for one of its best ever starts to a year, history can’t be a guide this time.】

item.title: 墨西哥以 27 亿美元扩建港口应对特朗普威胁
item.description: 墨西哥将目光投向即将上台的特朗普政府的关税威胁之外，无论其北方邻国和最大的贸易伙伴采取何种行动，墨西哥都对全球商品贸易的光明前景充满信心。【原文：Mexico is looking beyond the incoming Trump administration’s threats of tariffs, betting on a bright future for global merchandise trade no matter what actions its northern neighbor and biggest trading partner takes.】

item.title: 迪拜的房地产热潮让买家跃跃欲试
item.description: 迪拜转变为世界上最热门的房地产市场之一，越来越多的买家被挤出市场，导致人们对房地产投资信托基金的兴趣复苏，并促使许多人转向只需支付 136 美元的部分所有权应用程序。【原文：Dubai’s transformation into one of the world’s hottest property markets is increasingly pricing out buyers, leading to a revival of interest in real estate investment trusts and prompting many to turn to fractional ownership apps that require as little as $136 in payments.】

item.title: 马来西亚向中国展示如何保持 5%的增长
item.description: 中国自制定 2024 年 5%左右的经济增长目标以来，一直在推出新的经济支持措施，试图实现这一目标。对于许多国家来说，即使是那些发展水平较低、追赶潜力巨大的国家，这个目标也很难实现。【原文：China has been unveiling fresh economic-support measures to try and meet its 2024 growth target of around 5% practically since it set the goal. For many nations—even those lower on the development scale with lots of catch-up potential—that mark is hard to sustain.】
